title: Nonideal circuit set - V value if nonideal battery

content.description: Several circuits are to be constructed, all as shown in the figure. The battery, ammeter, and voltmeter may or may not be considered to be ideal in each of the circuits.
content.question: Two more circuits are constructed according to the circuit diagram, both with ideal voltmeters, ideal ammeters, and identical resistors. One circuit has an ideal battery and the second circuit has a nonideal battery with the same <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> as the ideal battery. How does the nonideal battery affect the voltmeter reading, and what reasoning supports the claim?

choices.label: The voltmeter reading is higher with a nonideal battery. The finite internal resistance in the battery results in more current in the resistor.
The voltmeter reading is higher with a nonideal battery. The finite internal resistance in the battery results in more current in the voltmeter.
The voltmeter reading is lower with a nonideal battery. The current leaked by the battery results in less current in the resistor.
The voltmeter reading is lower with a nonideal battery. The nonzero internal resistance in the battery results in less current in the resistor.

content.answer: The voltmeter reading is lower with a nonideal battery. The nonzero internal resistance in the battery results in less current in the resistor.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
